Articles.Content:
Would'nt it be cool to watch all your failures and crashes that you even do on purpose in slow motion.

How about a slo-mo warp?

You could have like 1/2 speed or 1/4 speeds.
Actually, I would really like this idea if it had an option to disable in difficulty settings. Coulda make for some awesome stunts too...
You'd have loved my old laptop .

To make this possible it would have to actually record your flight first. To record your flight the base game would have to be a little less computer intensive and a little more stable. I can't see anything like this happening until after Unity 5, but it is a good idea and you have my support.

Why would it have to record it? Could it not just do the physics slower?

BTW thanks for the sword, I'll stick it on my next rocket along with that old laptop

EDIT: Sorry I don't think I was clear. I ment a time warp not a replay.

Edited September 9, 2014 by worir4

*ahem* Check my sig.

I had actually pondered making a replay thing once, that would be really cool. Quite complicated though.

*ahem* Check my sig.

I had actually pondered making a replay thing once, that would be really cool. Quite complicated though.

Couldn't it be somehow merged with persistent trails?

Couldn't it be somehow merged with persistent trails?

I wasn't aware of persistent trails until earlier, it may work alongside persistent trails actually, haven't tried.

*ahem* Check my sig.

I had actually pondered making a replay thing once, that would be really cool. Quite complicated though.

That looks awesome. Does it blend in with the stock time warp controls?
